<<<api>>>: ProgressDialog.dismiss
<<<code>>>: 
new AsyncTask<Void, Void, String[]>() {
    ProgressDialog pd;

    @Override
    protected void onPreExecute() {
        super.onPreExecute();
        pd = new ProgressDialog(YourActivity.this);
        pd.setMessage("Parsing...");
        pd.show();
    }

    @Override
    protected String[] doInBackground(Void... params) {
        return parseXmlFile();
    }

    @Override
    protected void onPostExecute(String[] ret) {
        super.onPostExecute(ret);
        if (pd != null && pd.isShowing()) {
            pd.dismiss();
        }
        if (ret[0].equals("steve")) {
            sayHiToSteve();
        }
    }
}.execute();
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses AsyncTask to parse the XML file in the background while showing a ProgressDialog. The ProgressDialog is dismissed in the onPostExecute method, which is called after the background computation finishes. The check for ret[0] == "steve" is also done in the onPostExecute method, ensuring that it only happens after the XML file has been parsed.
